Country_Code_ISO3166.description: Specifies a 2 character country code as defined in ISO3166.

NameType.description:
OTA Code list: Name Type	NAM	
	1	Former
	2	Nickname
	3	Alternate
	4	Maiden

StateProv_Code.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

Telephone_Extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number

Telephone_AreaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

Telephone_CountryAccessCode.description: Used for Numeric Strings length 1 to 3.

Address_BldgRoom.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

buldingInd.description: When true, the information is a building name.

streetNmbrSuffix.description: Usually a letter right after the street number (A in 66-A, B in 123-B etc).

streetDirection.description: Street direction of an address (e.g., N, E, S, NW, SW).

ruralRouteNmbr.description: Numerical equivalent of a rural township as defined within a given area (e.g., 12, 99).

pO_Box.description: Defines a Post Office Box number.

name.description: The name or code of a country (e.g. as used in an address or to specify citizenship of a traveller).

Email.description: Electronic email addresses, in IETF specified format.

emailType.description: Defines the purpose of the e-mail address (e.g. personal, business, listserve). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Email Address Type (EAT).

remark.description: A remark associated with the e-mail address.

shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid email address that has been system verified via a successful email transmission.

defaultInd.description: If true, this identifies this is the default email address.

Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

StateProv.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

name.description: State, province, or region name or code needed to identify location.

Telephone_Simple.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

TelephoneDetail.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

pIN.description: Additional codes used for pager or telephone access rights.

remark.description: A remark associated with the telephone number.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

PhoneLocationType.description: Describes the location of the phone, such as Home, Office, Property Reservation Office, etc.

PhoneTechType.description: Indicates type of technology associated with this telephone number, such as Voice, Data, Fax, Pager, Mobile, TTY, etc.

PhoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Phone Use Type (PUT).

defaultInd.description: When true, indicates a default value should be used.

Text_Free.description: Textual information to provide descriptions and/or additional information.

Person_Document_Simple.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

DocType.description: Indicates the type of document (e.g. Passport, Military ID, Drivers License, national ID, Vaccination Certificate). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Document Type (DOC).

Code_OTA.description: Used for codes in the OpenTravel Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 1001, 101.EQP, 1001.EQP or 1001.EQP.X.

id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

Identifier.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

maritalStatus_Enum.description: Specifies the marital status of the person.

birthDate.description: The birth date of the person.

Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

Address_Simple.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

Address.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

Number.description: May contain the street number and optionally the street name.

Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

AddressDetail.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Communication Location Type (CLT).

use.description: Describes the use of the address (e.g. mailing, delivery, billing, etc.). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Address Use Type (AUT).

Remark.description: A remark associated with this address.

examples.value: This address should be used for all official correspondences.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of address information between parties.

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid and complete mailing address that has been verified through an address verification service or previously mailed materials have not been returned.
